alert.note: Alert for Grady (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 10:46PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Grady County through 1115 PM EDT... At 1046 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Havana, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cairo, Reno, Grady Co A/p, Princes Still, Moncrief, Pine Park, Rocky Hill and Beachton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for south central and southwestern Georgia.
